flawed_nl_solution:
Mark has 10 fewer cards than Michael so Mark has 100 cards - 10 cards = 90 cards.
So, Lloyd has 90 cards / 3 = <<90/3=30.0>>30.0 cards.
All three of them have 90 cards + 30.0 cards + 100 cards = <<90+30.0+100=202.0>>202.0 cards.
Thus, they need to collect 300 cards - 202.0 cards = <<300-202.0=98.0>>98.0 more cards.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 220.0, not 202.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
